#Text=Yading
#Text=Yading ( Chinese : 亚丁 ) is in Sichuan , China .
#Text=This contains the National Nature Reserve of China ( 亞丁國家級自然保護區菅理局宣 ) known under the same name , and at .

column3: 亞丁國家級自然保護區菅理局宣

column1: #Text=The only gateway is the town that used to be known as Riwa but was renamed ( Xiānggélǐlā , 香格里拉镇 ) .
#Text=The town is a complete rebuild and has no intact old town today , however it is a good option if you are coping with high altitude since it is below .
#Text=Do not confuse this Shangri-La with the city Zhongdian aka Shangrila ( 香格里拉市 ) in Yunnan , which sports a famous Buddhist monastery .
#Text=History
#Text=In March 1928 , Joseph Rock set out from Muli , trekked through Daocheng and described what is now known as Yading .
#Text=In Tibetan Buddhism the three holy mountains represent Arya Avalokiteshwara ( Xiannairi at 6032 m ) , Manjusri Buddisattva ( Yangmaiyong at 5958 m ) and Vajrapani ( Xianuoduoji at 5958 m ) .
#Text=Landscape
#Text=The area contains more than 30 peaks above 4500 m ( 14500 ft ) and more than 60 glacial lakes .
#Text=It is part of the Himalayan plateau .
#Text=Flora and fauna
#Text=You can see deer , pheasant , marmots , foxes well as yak on the grasslands .
#Text=Get in
#Text=Suggested route from Chengdu is via Kangding and then to Daocheng , the latter costing around ¥ 150 by bus or private van/per person ( as of 2019 ) .
#Text=From Daocheng private cars run to the town of Riwa and then on uphill to the entrance gate for ¥ 50 - 60 .
#Text=Fees and permits
#Text=The in-season rate for the entrance ticket is now a steep ¥ 270 or ¥ 200 for students with identification ( foreign visitors are also asked a passport copy ) .
#Text=The automatic ticket machines seen only accept WeChat Pay , you might want to ask someone to accept your cash and pay for you with their Weixin app .
#Text=The minibus inside the park is ¥50/90 one-way/return .
#Text=Get around

#Text=Three stages : the entrance gate just outside of Riwa , where you buy the tickets and get on the mandatory bus to Yading village ( 亚丁村）after around 50 minutes and then in another 10 minutes to the base at Longtongba ( 龙同坝 ) .

#Text=From the base at Longtongba it ’s a short scenic walk before you reach the Chonggu ( 沖古 ) temple and meadow , as well as the service centre from where you can catch a minibus that serves about 10 stops before turning at Luorong ( 洛绒 ) pasture and service centre .

#Text=From late November ( until late March ? ) the bus schedule is reduced with the first one at 08:30 and the last bus back around 17:20 , thus likely you will need to go at least one-way with the minibus , if you wanted to hike to the two popular lakes in one day .
#Text=See
#Text=Wildlife and Chinese tourism .
#Text=Echu Shan 俄初山 at 5145 m.
#Text=Three holy mountains :
#Text=Mount Chianrezig ( Chinese : Xiannairi 仙乃日需峰 ) . at 6032 m.
#Text=Mount Jambeyang ( Chinese : Yangmaiyong 央迈勇需峰 ) at 5958m
#Text=Mount Chanadorje ( Chinese : Xianuoduoji 夏诺多吉需峰 ) at 5958m
#Text=Glacier lakes :
#Text=Danzhen Lake ( 五色海 , “ five color lake”）
#Text=Erong Lake ( 牛奶海 , “ milk lake”）
#Text=Rese Lake ( 智慧海 , “ wisdom lake”）
#Text=Zhuoma La Cuo 桌瑪拉措
#Text=Biyao Cuo 比幺措
#Text=Do
#Text=Hiking and camping in this beautiful surroundings is possible year-round , but not recommended from December to April due to snow fall and generally more dull coloration .
#Text=The popular option is hiking up to Five-color Lake and Milk Lake , the 10-km return route is well marked and mostly steps leading up about 400-m gain .
#Text=To the local Tibetans , these lakes are holy and dipping in or even walking on the frozen parts is frowned upon .
#Text=Another route inside the park is a short but less crowded visit to Pearl Lake in combination with Chonggu Grasslands on the way back ( less than 3 km ) .
#Text=If you know what you are doing , the hike beyond these lakes can be done with proper camping equipment and food .
#Text=Leave no trace is best practice here as well , although the mass tourism unfortunately seems to lack the understanding that it applies to its customers .
#Text=Buy
#Text=There is an ATM at the park entrance as well as left luggage service for a fee .
#Text=Food supplies can be found in Riwa and in limited selection also in Yading village .
#Text=Lodging
#Text=Plenty of options are available in both Riwa and also Yading village .
#Text=The former boasts a number of hotels and also a youth hostel , the latter has many options that can easily be found walking from park bus stop number 2 .
#Text=Camping
#Text=Despite being legal there is not much official information on camping in the designated campgrounds , which are a day ’s hike away from the base at Longtongba 龙同坝。
#Text=Backcountry
#Text=Depending on the willingness of local herdsman to accept guests or allow camping without official designation .
#Text=Stay safe
#Text=Be aware of AMS altitude sickness , as the park is all above 4,000 m.

#Text=The hike on the flat boardwalks should be no problem of you are accustomed to the altitude above 3,000 m , but hiking uphill still should be taken on carefully , as exercise in the high altitude puts extra stress on your system .
#Text=Go next
#Text=There does not seem to be a connecting service south to Lugu_Lake ( as of 2018 ) , but the road towards Muli is being constructed .
#Text=The local options are Xiangcheng on the way to Shangrila in Yunnan as well as Daocheng , the latter connects to the airport and to Litang further north .
